title: Re: 'Inactivity' Poll
content:
I'd hate to see a whole bunch of meaningless (sub)forums, but that should never have to happen.
Looking at LordOfGlobox's post and the current situation...

A forum on the games, one on mods, and one on fan games.
Perhaps the last 2 can/should be merged, if there is some kind of rule that new thread subjects have to start with "MOD" or "FAN", or perhaps a graphical indication like that.

The "other Keen stuff" could be merged with an overall art forum; right now we see non-Keen art every now and again anyway.
I think most art posted about will be Keen-related, so the off-topic-ness shouldn't turn out too bad.

A "release forum" isn't even necesary in my opinion, a sticky thread in the mod forum (and one in the fan game forum) giving a list of everything will do just fine.
Discussions about finished stuff can take place in the original work-in-progress threads.
Some "finished" stuff ends up being revisted later anyway, although a clear way to see which ones are actually playable (sticky thread) would be very helpful for those not interested in beta testing / having problems with incomplete stuff, level warp codes &c..

The "voting" forum can go if you ask me, both of them actually, no need to make that disctinction.

Perhaps the Keen awards should be renamed "Events", so it's more useful (for other things).
There aren't many Keen-related events though...
Maybe add a list of people's birthday's... although of course most forum software already has a better way to do that.

An off-topic forum, of course.
One for other video games as well, closely related to the Keen games, and specific enough to warrant a forum, and I guess one for films, books, &c. is wanted as well, although I'm not sure those need loose forums.
Maybe an "Other media" forum or something?

That makes:

- Commander Keen games
- Mods & fan games
- Events
- Artwork (both Keen and other)
- Random talk (incl. films and books)
- Video games

That's six forums (we have ten now), so even with some extra forums people might want there's some extra room.
This is just my (current) idea for the optimal format; I'm sure people disagree.Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: 'Inactivity' Poll
content:
I feel that it is important to split Mods and Fangames up, mainly becuase people want us to merge with another forum. But that aside, I think it really is important. People really like making Mods (I've never made one, to be honest), and some people really like making Fangames (That's me and my 8 attempts at Keen and Norp). Mods need Mod help, Fangames need Fangame help. They seem to be like two different groups.


Now, I would split that with one other forum you stated, and that's 'Random Talk'. I'd split that into Casual Lounge and Discussion and Debate. We have plenty of both, no need to mix the two.

Now, I see no reason to have an 'Events forum', as you can post that on the Forum calender. (Another nice boost of not using Ezboard.) And you could just PM an Admin to put it up.

We'll need, however, an Announcements forum, for Mods and Admins to post news about the site (New features, subforum changes, etc) --that ONLY staff can post in, so it won't be a big concern.


This leaves us with:


1. Announcements
2. Official Keen Games
3. Keen Fangames
4. Keen Mods
5. Casual Lounge
6. Discussion and Debate
7. Video games


That's seven, perfectly organized. What say you all?~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: hmm.
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]
Djaser:

I think you all want to much subforums, most of them have almost none new posts fusing them would be much better.

1. Official Keen Games
2. Fanart (mods, unnoficial games, artwork, etc.)
3. The Classics
4. Miscaleneous
5. The Theater
6. Modern Video games

Subforums 3,5,6 are put there just to stimulate some special discussions.

Recent topics can easily be moved by an mod or admin and the rest can be put in an archive.

[hr][/quote]
Making this forum smaller isn't going to help. I think we have established that a smaller forum makes for less activity which makes for less over all fun.


People want a Keen Mods subforum, not to combine EVERYTHING into one damned "Keen Artwork" that way EVERYTHING gets lost in the hustle and bustle.


Making this forum more compact is stupid, to be brutally honest. We need a focused forum, not a compacted one.


The reason this forum is becoming so pathetic (Aside from it being summer) is that there's no good area to debate, there's no good area to just talk, there's no good area to discuss Keen Mods, etc --because it is all mixed! Compacting is a waste of time. 7 forums is hardly big, by any stretch of the imagination.


Djaser, can you tell me what is so insidious about this subforum line-up?

1. Announcements.
2. Official Keen Game Discussion
3. Keen Fangame Discussion
4. Keen Mods Discussion
5. Discussion and Debate
6. Casual Lounge
7. Video Games


That's seven forums! How is seven subforums too big? I go to forums that have a minimum of 20+ subforums, but no one gets lost in the mix.


What I am proposing is small, and yet focussed. I don't see how I am proposing to make 'lots of subforums'.


What say you?~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: heh
content:
I suggested a forums reorganization of K:M a while back, and the gap between establishing the framework and the actual mass moving of posts is legendary. It took hours of clicking and moving (and actually creating posts with my own user name and then cutting and pasting)...and that was with phpBB software--imagine how much the poor EzBoard system would strain under such a workload!

I don't doubt that your system of organization would work rather well--but given the amount of effort and time involved to move the pages and pages of posts around to get it working, I can't help but think we're better off with what we already have.

Of course, that just re-raises the "omg let's get off EzBoard!" issue.

Like I said before, if something really contains useful information, it's often better off on a regular old website.Retodon8
